name: barley grain to generic market for energy feed | energy feed, gross | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1214/documentation

This is a linking activity that converts barley grain into gross energy for the feed market and protein, 100% crude for the feed market. ;The naming of the dataset is based on the feed nomenclature system of the National Research Council (USA).  Products with less than 20 percent of protein are classified as energy feeds. Products with more than 20 percent of protein are classified as protein feeds.

The activity starts with the reception of barley grain

The activity ends with the conversion of barley grain into gross energy and crude protein
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/108:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds/1080:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: the technology is considered modern for modelling purposes in the consequential (system expansion) system model.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: inventory based on gross energy and protein composition of raw material. Data obtained from Agroscope database of feedstuff compositions.

flow.name: energy feed, gross
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/108:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds/1080:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds

exchanges.description: input of fresh barley grain is based on the dry matter content (0.86) and the gross energy of barley grain (18.10MJ/kg dry mass)

flow.name: barley grain
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds
